detaileddescription.para: 32-bits, offset 0x0, This register controls mapping of the peripheral device signals on Pmod connectors
32-bits, offset 0x4

32-bits, offset 0x8, SPI_MAP_CTRL[0] selects the mode of operation of the SPI Slave:
Normal operation, SPI_MAP_CTRL[0]=0: SPI Slave is connected to Pmod1 at connector J1.
Loop-back mode, SPI_MAP_CTRL[0]=1: SPI Slave is connected to the SPI Master inside the FPGA using CS4.
32-bits, offset 0x8, This register controls the mapping of the UART signals on the Pmod1 connector.
all pins are configured as GPIO inputs
normal SPI mode
TYPE4 PMOD compatible
Pmod1[4:1] are connected to DW GPIO Port C[11:8]
Pmod1[4:1] are connected to DW UART0 signals
Pmod1[10:7] are connected to DW GPIO Port A[11:8]
Pmod1[10:7] are connected to DW SPI Slave signals
Pmod2[4:1] are connected to DW GPIO Port C[15:12], Pmod2[10:7] are connected to DW GPIO Port A[15:12]
connect I2C to Pmod2[4:1] and halt/run interface to Pmod2[10:7]
Pmod3[4:1] are connected to DW GPIO Port C[19:16], Pmod3[10:7] are connected to DW GPIO Port A[19:16]
Pmod3[4:3] are connected to DW I2C signals, Pmod3[2:1] are connected to DW GPIO Port D[1:0], Pmod3[10:7] are connected to DW GPIO Port D[3:2]
Pmod4[4:1] are connected to DW GPIO Port C[23:20], Pmod4[10:7] are connected to DW GPIO Port A[23:20]
Pmod4[4:3] are connected to DW I2C signals, Pmod4[2:1] are connected to DW GPIO Port D[5:4], Pmod4[10:7] are connected to DW GPIO Port D[7:6]
Pmod5[4:1] are connected to DW GPIO Port C[27:24]
Pmod5[4:1] are connected to DW SPI Master signals using CS1_N
Pmod5[10:7] are connected to DW GPIO Port A[27:24]
Pmod5[10:7] are connected to DW SPI Master signals using CS2_N
Pmod6[4:1] are connected to DW GPIO Port C[31:28]
Pmod6[4:1] are connected to DW SPI Master signals using CS0_N
Pmod6[10:7] are connected to DW GPIO Port A[31:28]
Pmod6[8:7] are connected to the DW SPI Master chip select signals CS1_N and CS2_N, Pmod6[6:5] are connected to the ARC EM halt and sleep status signals
Pmod7[4:1] are connected to DW GPIO Port D[11:8]
Pmod7[4:1] are connected to the ARC EM sleep status signals
set PMOD muxer scheme

inbodydescription.para: < 32-bits, offset 0x0, This register controls mapping of the peripheral device signals on Pmod connectors

detaileddescription.para: get PMOD muxer scheme

inbodydescription.para: < 32-bits, offset 0x0, This register controls mapping of the peripheral device signals on Pmod connectors

detaileddescription.para: set SPI connection scheme

inbodydescription.para: < 32-bits, offset 0x8, SPI_MAP_CTRL[0] selects the mode of operation of the SPI Slave: - Normal operation, SPI_MAP_CTRL[0]=0: SPI Slave is connected to Pmod1 at connector J1. - Loop-back mode, SPI_MAP_CTRL[0]=1: SPI Slave is connected to the SPI Master inside the FPGA using CS4.

detaileddescription.para: set UART connection scheme

inbodydescription.para: < 32-bits, offset 0x8, This register controls the mapping of the UART signals on the Pmod1 connector.
< Default Arduino mode
< Pmod1[4:1] are connected to DW UART0 signals
< Pmod1[10:7] are connected to DW SPI Slave signals
< Pmod1[4:1] are connected to DW UART0 signals
< Pmod5[4:1] are connected to DW SPI Master signals using CS1_N
< Pmod5[4:1] are connected to DW SPI Master signals using CS1_N
< Pmod6[4:1] are connected to DW SPI Master signals using CS0_N
< Pmod6[4:1] are connected to DW SPI Master signals using CS0_N
< 32-bits, offset 0x0, This register controls mapping of the peripheral device signals on Pmod connectors
< all pins are configured as GPIO inputs

< 32-bits, offset 0x8, SPI_MAP_CTRL[0] selects the mode of operation of the SPI Slave: - Normal operation, SPI_MAP_CTRL[0]=0: SPI Slave is connected to Pmod1 at connector J1. - Loop-back mode, SPI_MAP_CTRL[0]=1: SPI Slave is connected to the SPI Master inside the FPGA using CS4.
< normal SPI mode
< 32-bits, offset 0x8, This register controls the mapping of the UART signals on the Pmod1 connector.
< TYPE4 PMOD compatible

listitem.para: Please refer to corresponding EMSK User Guide for detailed information -> Appendix: A Hardware Functional Description -> Pmods Configuration summary

Set up pin-multiplexer of all PMOD connections
PM1 J1: Upper row as UART 0, lower row as SPI Slave
PM2 J2: IIC 0 and run/halt signals
PM3 J3: GPIO Port A and Port C
PM4 J4: IIC 1 and Port D
PM5 J5: Upper row as SPI Master, lower row as Port A
PM6 J6: Upper row as SPI Master, lower row as Port A

inbodydescription.para: < Pmod1[4:1] are connected to DW UART0 signals
< Pmod1[10:7] are connected to DW SPI Slave signals
< connect I2C to Pmod2[4:1] and halt/run interface to Pmod2[10:7]
< Pmod3[4:1] are connected to DW GPIO Port C[19:16], Pmod3[10:7] are connected to DW GPIO Port A[19:16]
< Pmod4[4:3] are connected to DW I2C signals, Pmod4[2:1] are connected to DW GPIO Port D[5:4], Pmod4[10:7] are connected to DW GPIO Port D[7:6]
< Pmod5[4:1] are connected to DW SPI Master signals using CS1_N
< Pmod5[10:7] are connected to DW GPIO Port A[27:24]
< Pmod6[4:1] are connected to DW SPI Master signals using CS0_N
< Pmod6[10:7] are connected to DW GPIO Port A[31:28]
PM1 upper row as UART UM4:RXD, UM3:TXD UM2:RTS_N, UM1:CTS_N

detaileddescription.para: Mux controller is the hardware external PMOD port pin connection controller, it can distribute the external port pins into different functions like general input/output, spi, iic, uart and so on.
